intro: Euphrasia petriei, commonly known as the Petrie's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow markings, resembling eyes, which is characteristic of the genus Euphrasia. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Euphrasia petriei is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters.
